senses.sense_definition: Any of the group of American teachers sent to the Philippines in 1901, or arriving in the first few years of the American Colonial Period, to establish a public school system.

examples.text: The arrival of the <w>Thomasites</w> significantly influenced the development of the local education system.
My great-grandfather was a <w>Thomasite</w> who decided to stay in the province after his teaching contract ended.

senses.sense_definition: A member of the Christadelphians, a non-Trinitarian Christian denomination founded by John Thomas.

examples.text: In the mid-19th century, a follower of this movement was often referred to as a <w>Thomasite</w>.
The <w>Thomasite</w> community gathered to discuss the interpretations of scripture proposed by their founder.
